property.name: Hardware Type
property.description: This option selects which hardware to compile for.

property.name: Debug Print
property.description: When this define symbol is included the debug output for the application is displayed.

property.name: Wired Input
property.description: This define symbol sets up the application for Analogue or SPDIF Input Mode instead of USB Input Mode.

property.name: Dualstream
property.description: This define symbol adds DualStream operation to the Audio Adaptor. Note: The user PS Key for DualStream must also be configured to enable this feature.

property.name: Buttons
property.description: This define symbol adds button support to the application. The buttons used in the application are defined in the source_buttons.button file.

property.name: Leds
property.description: This define symbol will add LED support to the application. The LEDs used in the application are defined in the source_leds.led file.

property.name: MS LYNC Only
property.description: This define symbol only includes HFP support and configures the USB rate to be 16 kHz.

property.name: Use MIC 16K
property.description: This define symbol sets the USB rate to 16 kHz for the audio sent to the USB interface (mic interface). Normally this USB rate is 48 kHz. The USB rate for the audio received from USB (speaker interface) remains at 48 kHz.

property.name: Power Readings
property.description: The define symbol initialises the power library for receiving power readings from the hardware. This is generally used for an Analogue Input device.

property.name: App Codec Config
property.description: This define symbol is used so that the application can choose the A2DP codec configuration to use when an A2DP codec is being negotiated. The application code can be edited to choose the required configuration
